name: GitHub Copilot
tagline: AI pair programmer and coding agent across IDEs and GitHub.com
summary:
GitHub Copilot is GitHub’s AI coding assistant that surfaces code suggestions, test generation, inline explanations, and repository-aware chat directly in the IDE and on GitHub.com. It is available in three principal tracks—individual (Copilot Free, Pro, and Pro+), organizational (Copilot Business), and enterprise-wide (Copilot Enterprise)—with governance capabilities that matter in regulated, multi-team environments. Copilot integrates natively with Visual Studio Code, Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, and GitHub’s web UI, and augments the pull request and issue workflows with features like PR summaries, test authoring, and issue drafting. 


For organizations, Copilot adds admin guardrails, including content exclusion so you can centrally declare files or paths that Copilot must not read for context, as well as auditability to review changes to exclusion policies. Spend governance is built-in via request allowances and premium request monitoring so admins can track and cap higher-cost requests. Copilot’s security posture benefits from GitHub’s platform controls and SSO/SAML integration when used under Business or Enterprise. 


Teams standardize adoption through GitHub’s published playbooks and measurement guides, which outline how to pilot Copilot in controlled cohorts and quantify productivity impact over time. Customer stories document outcomes at scale—for example, large enterprises reporting improved developer satisfaction and faster delivery after centralizing development on GitHub and enabling Copilot. Enterprises can upgrade organizations from Copilot Business to Enterprise using documented steps, and manage plan changes—upgrades, downgrades, or billing cycle changes—at the organization or enterprise level. 


Copilot’s differentiators include its deep embedding in GitHub flows (pull requests, Issues, CLI), enterprise-grade policy controls, and continual investment in the “coding agent” that can tackle scoped development tasks from Issues. Copilot is best for engineering teams that already use GitHub and want AI assistance that is repository-aware, policy-governed, and measurable, with an adoption path that scales from individual developers to fully governed enterprises.
languages: Multiple programming languages (JS/TS, Python, Java, C#, Go, etc.)
data_controls: Spend controls and premium request monitoring

privacy.training_policy: See GitHub Copilot privacy and content policies

limits.free_tier: Copilot Free includes limited monthly usage; upgrade path documented in GitHub docs.

pricing_notes: Official documentation lists plan options and per-seat pricing for individuals and enterprises; upgrade flows between plans are documented.

pros: Deep GitHub integration across PRs, Issues, CLI, and web
Enterprise policy controls: content exclusion, spending, audit
Strong adoption resources and measurement guides
cons: Feature set varies by plan; premium requests metered
Best experience tied to GitHub ecosystem
Context window specifics not publicly fixed across modes

key_differentiators: Org/enterprise policy & audit for content exclusion
Evolving coding agent that executes scoped tasks from Issues
limitations: Plan-based feature access; org controls require Business/Enterprise
import_export: Works within IDEs and GitHub—no generic import/export artifacts
setup_time: Minutes for individuals; days/weeks for enterprise rollout

case_studies.title: Carlsberg unifies development on GitHub Enterprise and accelerates innovation with Copilot
Emirates NBD delivers cutting-edge digital banking with GitHub Copilot

migration_paths: Upgrade from Copilot Free → Pro or Pro+ via account settings (per individual docs)
Upgrade organization from Copilot Business → Copilot Enterprise at the enterprise level; downgrades supported (docs)
Manage license changes and billing cycle switches with proration rules documented by GitHub
alternatives_notes: Compares with other code assistants; strongest for GitHub-centric teams

reviews.title: Enterprise rollout playbook is clear
reviews.author: Customer story highlights
reviews.body: GitHub’s customer stories and adoption guides make it straightforward to pilot and scale Copilot with measurable impact.

tutorials.title: What’s new with the Copilot coding agent | GitHub Checkout

q_and_a.q: Can organizations exclude sensitive code from Copilot context?
q_and_a.a: Yes—organization and enterprise admins can configure content exclusion and audit policy changes.

q_and_a.q: How do I upgrade to Copilot Enterprise?
q_and_a.a: Enterprises can upgrade organizations from Copilot Business to Copilot Enterprise following the documented steps.
